intro: Lactucosonchus, commonly known as the common sowthistle, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of smooth, waxy leaves that are often covered in a fine white coating. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been naturalized in various regions around the world. Lactucosonchus is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in cultivated fields.
